Instruction: Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat or in a deep-fryer until it reaches 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Combine flour with salt and pepper in a shallow baking pan. In a separate bowl, whisk together egg whites, milk, vinegar, and remaining salt and pepper until frothy.
Coat onion rings by dipping them in the wet ingredients, then into the flour mixture, followed by another dip in the egg white mixture, and finally back into the flour.
Fry onion rings in batches in hot oil until golden brown; drain on paper towels and serve right away.
